result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett A Kelly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 14CF244

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brett A Kelly in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
(Defendant)
from Atty. Gary J. Kryshak, dated November 17, 2014, re Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant Brett A Kelly in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Kelly A. Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on November 14, 2014 at 09:45 am.

10:11 Defendant Brett A Kelly in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kelly did not provide the court with the petition for appointment of counsel.  Court addresses Kelly regarding his petition.  Court orders Kelly to contact the Public Defenders office to see if they will appoint and if they do not court will appoint Atty Kryshak.  Atty Gary Kryshak appears by phone.  Matter is reset for Arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Brett A Kelly in court.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Kelly regarding his appearance without counsel.  Court has Kelly fill out the petition for appointment of counsel and resets for Arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brett A Kelly in court.  Kelly A. Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kelly tried to contact Atty Kryshak because he represents him on his other case.  Court advises Kelly to contact the Public Defender's office to see if Atty Kryshak can be appointed on this case.  

Ryan Bannerman is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to his employment with Wood County Sheriff's Dept.  Testifies to being dispatched to 4988 Cty Trk F on 05/18/14 regarding a burglary.  Testifies to conversation with MSD regarding the burglary and other individuals involved.  One of individuals indicated by MSD as being involved in burglary was Brett Kelly.  Identifies Brett Kelly in the courtroom.  Testifies to conversation with Brett Kelly.  

Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over for Arraignment.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 26, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
No contact with F.M. or residence. Report to WCSD for fingerprinting.
9:35 Defendant Brett A Kelly in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Transferred to Branch 2 for preliminary hearing.
